text: The Ghana Independence Act 1957 is an act made by the Parliament of the United Kingdom in 1957. The act gave the colony of the Gold Coast an independent government in the Commonwealth of Nations.10.1093/oxfordjournals.pa.a054448 Queen Elizabeth II gave the Royal Assent on 7 February 1957. On 6 March 1957, the Gold Coast became independent with the name Ghana."The Independence of Ghana" == References == Category:Acts of the Parliament of the United Kingdom Category:History of Ghana Category:1957
title: Ghana Independence Act 1957
